name: cook
content:

A1 [ I or T ] When you cook food, you prepare it to be eaten by heating it in a particular way, such as baking or boiling, and when food cooks, it is heated until it is ready to eat: I don't cook meat very often.cook something for someone [ + two objects ] He cooked us a huge dinner./He cooked a huge dinner for us. Let the fish cook for half an hour before you add the wine.
More examplesFewer examplesDon't cook vegetables for too long - they'll lose all their goodness.Wrap the chicken in foil and cook it for two hours.Vicky cooks really well but she's rather messy.Do you prefer cooking with electricity or gas?I'm a terrible cook - nothing I try to make turns out the way it's supposed to.
